name: Fact-Checking Methods
description: Training in advanced methodologies for verifying information, detecting false claims, and countering disinformation.

cards.title: Fundamentals of Fact-Checking
cards.description: Understanding the core principles and importance of fact-checking in countering disinformation.
bulletpoints: Defining fact-checking and its role in information integrity.
Recognizing the necessity of independent verification.
Understanding biases in fact-checking organizations.

cards.title: Source Credibility Assessment
cards.description: Evaluating the reliability of sources through credibility analysis techniques.
bulletpoints: Identifying authoritative vs. dubious sources.
Checking for conflicts of interest in media organizations.
Examining the track record of a source for bias and reliability.

cards.title: Cross-Referencing & Triangulation
cards.description: Using multiple independent sources to verify claims and detect inconsistencies.
bulletpoints: Applying the rule of three: verifying facts across independent sources.
Spotting contradictions in reporting.
Identifying patterns of synchronized media narratives.

cards.title: Detecting Logical Fallacies & Manipulation
cards.description: Identifying logical fallacies and deceptive rhetoric in media and political discourse.
bulletpoints: Recognizing ad hominem, straw man, and false equivalency arguments.
Understanding how emotional appeals distort rational analysis.
Spotting red herrings and misdirection tactics.

cards.title: Reverse Image & Video Verification
cards.description: Utilizing forensic tools to analyze images and videos for manipulation.
bulletpoints: Using reverse image search to track the origin of photos.
Identifying deepfake videos and AI-generated content.
Examining metadata for tampering and inconsistencies.

cards.title: Social Media Disinformation Patterns
cards.description: Analyzing how disinformation spreads on social media and fact-checking viral claims.
bulletpoints: Tracking the amplification of falsehoods through bot networks.
Examining hashtag campaigns for artificial trends.
Identifying patterns of influence operations.

cards.title: AI-Assisted Fact-Checking
cards.description: Leveraging AI tools to automate and enhance fact-checking processes.
bulletpoints: Using AI-driven text analysis for detecting false narratives.
Deploying natural language processing to identify propaganda.
Recognizing limitations and biases in AI fact-checking algorithms.

cards.title: Government & Institutional Fact-Checking
cards.description: Assessing the validity of government-issued statements and institutional claims.
bulletpoints: Identifying political bias in official statements.
Examining discrepancies between official and independent reports.
Recognizing the use of selective statistics to mislead.

cards.title: Forensic Linguistics in Fact-Checking
cards.description: Using linguistic analysis to detect inconsistencies and deception in statements.
bulletpoints: Identifying linguistic markers of deception.
Recognizing strategic omissions and ambiguous phrasing.
Comparing speech patterns in authentic vs. fabricated statements.

cards.title: Countering Misinformation Through Public Awareness
cards.description: Developing strategies to educate the public and enhance media literacy.
bulletpoints: Creating educational content to debunk widespread myths.
Engaging in digital activism to challenge falsehoods.
Building decentralized truth-verification communities.
